summary.value: SharePoint Framework support for building client-side components

remarks.value: This package supports development of client-side components (e.g. web parts, client-side extensions, and applications) built using the SharePoint Framework. It defines the base classes and interfaces for functionality that is common across all client-side component types.

summary.value: The base class for client-side components such as BaseClientSideWebPart, BaseExtension, etc.

remarks.value: The constructor for this class is marked as internal; third party code should not inherit directly from this base class.

summary.value: Returns the component identifier as defined in the componentâ€™s associated manifest.

remarks.value: Each client-side component has an associated manifest that is used by the sp-loader to load its scripts, and which may include additional metadata about the component. The manifest is uniquely identified using a text string containing a lower case GUID value.

summary.value: Use the context object to access common services and state associated with the component.

remarks.value: Child classes are expected to override this field by redeclaring it with a specialized type. It is meant to be a read-only property; the type cannot be declared as read-only in the base class (because it is initialized outside the constructor), but child classes should redeclare it as readonly.

Third party code generally does not need to call this method; it will be invoked automatically when the lifecycle ends for a web part or extension. To perform custom cleanup when your component is disposed, override the

summary.value: A unique identifier for the instance of the component.

remarks.value: A given component implementation can be loaded multiple times on the page. For example, if the component is a charting web part, multiple instances of this web part could be added to the SharePoint canvas. The instanceId uniquely identifies each of these instances.

summary.value: Returns true if the component has been already disposed.
Provides access to the manifest for the client-side component.

remarks.value: Child classes may override this with more specialized manifest types.

summary.value: This event hook is called at the end of the component's lifecycle. It provides an opportunity to release any associated resources, cancel any outstanding requests, etc.
The base class for context objects for client-side components.

remarks.value: A "context" object is a collection of well-known services and other objects that are likely to be needed by business logic that interacts with a associated component. Each component type has its own specialized subclass of BaseComponentContext, e.g. WebPartContext for web parts, ExtensionContext for client-side extensions, and so on.
The constructor for this class is marked as internal; third party code should not inherit directly from this base class.

summary.value: A unique identifier for the instance of the component.

remarks.value: A given component implementation can be loaded multiple times on the page. For example, if the component is a charting web part, multiple instances of this web part could be added to the SharePoint canvas. The instanceId uniquely identifies each of these instances.

summary.value: Manifest for the client side component.
The page context provides standard definitions for common SharePoint objects that need to be shared between the client-side application, web parts, and other components.

remarks.value: A child service scope is created for each client-side component.
